description.narrative: The Spindle connects innovators among Dutch and global actors into an online and offline movement for inclusive (meaning: for everyone), sustainable development. It was initiated by Partos, the association of Dutch NGOs working in international development, in the conviction that there's a huge innovation potential amongst the Dutch organizations and their southern partners. With The Spindle we take up the challenge to translate the abundance of ideas into innovative approaches and solutions. The Spindle builds on the experiences of Partos with joint learning and innovation initiatives by its members, in most recent years taking place as part of the Partos Learning Platform. The Spindle is financially made possible by a grant from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The grant secures a 5 year programme during which we will prove our value in two ways: by connecting and empowering innovators in inclusive and sustainable development - and secondly by creating an ecosystem that thrives innovation. The Spindle supports ideation, facilitates innovation, showcases successes, monitors trends and builds and facilitates an online and offline community. In light of the trends and existing challenges we decided in consultation with Partos member organisations to focus on civic power, inclusion, new forms of cooperation and the innovative use of data in the development of strategies and the implementation of programs.

This is the total commitment of the 425000 own contribution from Partos

The Spindle’s Theory of Change (ToC) is a conceptual model. It explains how the intervention strategies are intended to stimulate short-term, intermediate and long-term outcomes to achieve the desired impact. It contains assumptions which correspond to the arrows that lead from one level of outcomes to the next. The Spindles focuses on four important themes: Leave No One Behind, Civic Power, New Ways of Working Together and Making Data Count. These themes run through all levels of the Theory of Change.
